basics.name: Ana Díaz Vidal
basics.label: Environmental Policy Researcher
basics.summary: I work and learn best at the crossroads of disciplines, with systems thinking and ecology at my core. I explore political economy, policy analysis, and the theorization of economy-environment relations, focusing on post-growth, degrowth, sufficiency and Buen Vivir.

work.name: REN21
work.summary: Leading research and strategy at REN21, including report authorship, data methodologies, expert interviews, and conference planning.
highlights: Authored key sections in REN21 reports (e.g. Oil & Gas finance, Industry module).
Developed data structures and analysis methods using Python and AI.
Conducted 30+ expert interviews for the 2024 AUSIREC programme.

work.name: University of Edinburgh
work.summary: Contributed to an interdisciplinary hutting project with historians, ecologists, and architects.
highlights: Explored social and environmental value of traditional turf hut.
Used ethnographic methods, interviews, and surveys.

work.name: Sustrans
work.summary: Analyzed pre- and post-COVID active travel projects.
highlights: Tested variables like population and urban/rural context.
